meanings.definition: A space completely filled with matter.
meanings.sent1: The plenum of the balloon was inflated with air.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse was a plenum of boxes and crates.
meanings.sent3: The plenum of toys in the room made it difficult to walk without stepping on something.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a plenum of trees, creating a dense canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The plenum of water in the glass spilled over the edges.

meanings.sent1: The plenum of students gathered in the auditorium for the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The plenum of delegates discussed important matters at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The plenum of animals in the zoo eagerly awaited the feeding time.
meanings.sent4: The plenum of stars in the sky shone brightly during the night.
meanings.sent5: The plenum of guests at the wedding enjoyed the festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A condition of fullness or abundance.
meanings.sent1: The garden was a plenum of colorful flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent2: The market was a plenum of fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The plenum of ideas in the brainstorming session sparked creativity among the team.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a plenum of love for her family and friends.
meanings.sent5: The plenum of books on the shelves offered a wide selection for readers.
